title: 📊 Market Intel — Mon Feb 16 2026 8:40 PM ET
content:
# 📊 Market Intel — Mon Feb 16, 2026 @ 8:40 PM ET

**Top Headlines: Bitcoin crashes to $68K amid recession fears | Markets closed for Presidents' Day | Harvard shifts from BTC to ETH | AI vs Open Source debate heats up | NBA All-Star Weekend wraps up**

---

## 🔥 Top Trending

- **Bitcoin plunges to $68,000** — Massive sell-off across crypto. Mike McGlone warns BTC could fall to $10K as U.S. recession risk builds. Strategy (formerly MicroStrategy) says it can survive BTC at $8K.
- **Markets closed — Presidents' Day** — U.S. equities shut. Last close: S&P 500 at 6,836 (+0.05%), DJIA 49,501 (+0.10%), Nasdaq 22,547 (-0.22%).
- **Harvard cuts Bitcoin exposure 20%, adds Ether** — Major institutional rotation signal. Unwinding BTC treasury premium trade.
- **Ether steadies after $540M sell wave** — ETH outperforming broader crypto despite the carnage.
- **Fed minutes due this week** — Key catalyst. Hive & Riot earnings also on deck for crypto miners.

---

**Key levels:** US 10Y yield at 4.048%. Gold at $4,969.90. Brent crude at $68.58.

---

## 💰 Crypto & Digital Assets

- **BTC: ~$68,000** — Crypto market "drowns in red." Worst sell-off in weeks.
- **Mike McGlone (Bloomberg Intelligence):** Links BTC downturn to record U.S. market cap-to-GDP, low equity volatility, rising gold — warns of contagion into stocks.
- **Strategy (MSTR):** Claims survival even at BTC $8K, plans to "equitize" debt.
- **Harvard endowment:** Cut BTC exposure 20%, added new ETH position. Institutional rotation signal.
- **ETH:** Steadied after $540M sell wave, outperforming wider crypto market.
- **Nexo re-enters U.S.** three years after regulatory exit. Partners with Bakkt for yield, lending, exchange.
- **Hong Kong SFC** approves first crypto company license since June (Victory Fintech).
- **A7A5 stablecoin:** U.S.-sanctioned ruble-pegged stablecoin issuer racing to build crypto giant despite sanctions.
- **Binance's CZ:** Privacy concerns blocking crypto adoption (Consensus panel).
- **Week ahead:** Hive & Riot earnings, Fed rate-decision minutes.

---

- **McGlone's $10K BTC call** spreading fast — contrarian take getting heavy engagement.
- **Harvard ETH rotation** — Institutional shift narrative gaining traction.
- **Presidents' Day = low volume** — Equity FinTwit quiet, crypto taking all attention.

- **No major SpaceX launches reported** for today.
- **Crypto mining energy debate** — Paradigm responding to U.S. policy pushback on data/mining facility energy usage. DOGE-adjacent regulatory thread.

---

## 💻 AI & Tech

- **"AI is destroying Open Source"** — Jeff Geerling's blog post trending on HN (42 pts). Argues AI is degrading OSS ecosystem even before reaching maturity.
- **"Self-generated Agent Skills are useless"** — Academic paper on arXiv trending hard (239 pts on HN). Questions fundamental AI agent architecture assumptions.
- **GPT 4,600x faster in pure C** — Dev optimized Karpathy's microgpt.py with SIMD auto-vectorization. No dependencies.
- **Docker + NanoClaw** — Running AI agents in Docker shell sandboxes gaining traction.
- **Free voice-to-text alternative** — Zach Latta's "FreeFlow" (alt to Wispr Flow/Superwhisper) trending on HN.
- **Visual PyTorch intro** — Educational resource at 120 pts, strong HN engagement.
- **Silicon Valley Bank:** "This is crypto's year of integration" — bank-led stablecoins, tokenized T-bills, AI-powered wallets moving from pilots to production.
